column4: I get this error when trying to sudo apt-get install filezilla:
Could not get lock /var/lib/dpkg/lock - open (11 Resource temporarily unavailable)
E: Unable to lock the administration directory (/var/lib/dpkg/), is another process using it?
Anyone know what that means or how to fix it?
wait, now it says it can't find file filezilla
I get the same error for both
I see that filezilla is packaged for Ubuntu
I'm running dapper - it is in one of the standard (i.e. not backport) repos
once you know to use synaptic or aptitude or apt-get, then installation becomes *more* convenient
if that doesn't work, then do: /msg ubotu repos
use the command-line for now, and you probably want to read the man page, and configure first before starting the service
unfortunately, to run a service like FTP requires some reading/configuration
to start the service (once it is configured!) you would do something like:  /etc/init.d/vsftpd start
